A year after the hash tag me too movement took off a new NPR Ipsos poll shows deep divisions over the issue of sexual assault and harassment NPR's Tovia Smith reports that the disagreement is mostly along party lines
A majority of those surveyed say the movement has assured in a new era of accountability and which offenders and we'll be held accountable and about a third seemed to think the movement has not yet gone far enough saying they believe allegations of sexual harassment still get ignored
But a larger chunk forty three percent say me too has gone too far including three quarters of Republicans versus one quarter of Democrats
Republicans are also much more likely to say false accusations are common and they tend to be more forgiving of political candidates who've been accused of sexual misconduct most Democrats say that's a deal breaker most Republicans do not Tovia Smith NPR News
